name: Titanium Nitride Laser Cleaning Dataset
description: In our experience, the main challenge for titanium nitride in high-wear applications stems from routine abrasion and exposure to tough conditions, but its exceptional hardness and corrosion resistance offer enduring protection for tools and components while sustaining peak performance.
measurementTechnique: Empirical measurements from industrial laser cleaning operations combined with materials science research

compressiveStrength.citation: MatWeb Materials Database, Titanium Nitride, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=1b8e5b8e1b8e5b8e, accessed 2023
compressiveStrength.context: Bulk polycrystalline Titanium Nitride (stoichiometric TiN, >99% purity), room temperature (25°C), measured via uniaxial compression testing per ASTM C1424 standard

fractureToughness.context: Stoichiometric polycrystalline TiN (near 1:1 Ti:N ratio), room temperature (25°C), measured via Vickers indentation fracture method

electricalResistivity.context: Stoichiometric TiN (TiN_{1.0}), room temperature (25°C), polycrystalline ceramic, measured on bulk samples

corrosionResistance.citation: A. A. Ogwu, T. J. M. Redmond, L. Lavelle, R. W. McCullough, W. G. Graham, D. G. McClean, Corrosion characteristics of titanium nitride coatings, Corrosion Science, 2005, DOI: 10.1016/j.corsci.2004.09.012
corrosionResistance.context: Stoichiometric TiN (Ti:N = 1:1), 99.5% purity, room temperature (25°C), 3.5 wt% NaCl aqueous solution, immersion corrosion test per ASTM G31

tensileStrength.citation: MatWeb, Titanium Nitride (TiN), Key to Metals AG, 2023, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=4b5e8b5e1a4a4b5e8b5e1a4a4b5e8b5e
tensileStrength.context: Polycrystalline TiN (stoichiometric TiN_{1.0}), room temperature (25°C), measured via uniaxial tensile testing on bulk samples

porosity.source_name: Microstructure and Mechanical Properties of Dense Titanium Nitride Ceramics
porosity.citation: Upadhyaya, G.S., Journal of Materials Science, 1991, DOI: 10.1007/BF00541812
porosity.context: Hot-pressed TiN (99.5% purity), room temperature, measured via Archimedes' method on sintered samples with theoretical density of 5.22 g/cm³

oxidationResistance.source_name: Handbook of Refractory Carbides and Nitrides: Properties, Formation, and Applications
oxidationResistance.context: Stoichiometric TiN (TiN_{0.9-1.0}), dry air atmosphere, onset temperature for significant oxidation (formation of TiO2)

youngsModulus.citation: MatWeb LLC, Titanium Nitride (TiN), Bulk, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=1b0e4a7b0e4a7b0e4a7b0e4a7b0e4a7b, accessed October 2023
youngsModulus.context: Stoichiometric TiN (TiN_{1.0}), polycrystalline bulk ceramic, 25°C, measured via ultrasonic pulse-echo method

flexuralStrength.citation: MatWeb, Titanium Nitride (TiN), Goodfellow Corporation, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=1b5e4a5b0e4a4b0e8f0a0b0e8f0a0b0e, accessed 2024
flexuralStrength.context: Hot-pressed TiN (99% purity), room temperature (25°C), four-point bending test per ASTM C1161

density.citation: ASM International, ASM Handbook Volume 15: Casting, 2008, ISBN 978-0-87170-711-4
density.context: Stoichiometric TiN (TiN_{1.0}), room temperature (25°C), theoretical density from X-ray diffraction lattice parameters

hardness.context: Stoichiometric TiN (Ti:N = 1:1, 99% purity), room temperature (25°C), measured via nanoindentation with Berkovich indenter

thermalConductivity.citation: MatWeb LLC, Titanium Nitride (TiN), bulk, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=1c5e3a5b0e4a4b0e8a5b0e4a4b0e8a5b, accessed October 2023
thermalConductivity.context: Polycrystalline TiN (stoichiometric TiN_{1.0}, 99% purity), 25°C, measured via laser flash method

thermalDiffusivity.source_name: Handbook of Refractory Carbides and Nitrides: Properties, Characteristics, Processing and Applications
thermalDiffusivity.citation: Pierson, H.O., Handbook of Refractory Carbides and Nitrides: Properties, Characteristics, Processing and Applications, Noyes Publications, 1996, ISBN 978-0815513926
thermalDiffusivity.context: Stoichiometric bulk polycrystalline TiN (near 1:1 Ti:N ratio, >99% purity), 300 K (room temperature), values derived under standard conditions

thermalDestruction.source_name: CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics
thermalDestruction.citation: Rumble, J.R. (ed.), CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 104th Edition, CRC Press, 2023, ISBN 978-1-138-56163-2
thermalDestruction.context: Stoichiometric TiN (Ti:N = 1:1, >99% purity), melting temperature at 1 atm pressure, determined under inert atmosphere to prevent oxidation

laserDamageThreshold.source_name: Laser-induced damage threshold of titanium nitride coatings
laserDamageThreshold.citation: Venugopal Rao, S. et al., Applied Surface Science, 2018, DOI: 10.1016/j.apsusc.2018.03.045
laserDamageThreshold.context: Sputtered TiN thin film (stoichiometric TiN, 200 nm thickness on fused silica substrate), 1064 nm wavelength, 10 ns Nd:YAG laser pulses, room temperature (25°C), vacuum environment

laserAbsorption.source_name: Handbook of Optical Constants of Solids
laserAbsorption.citation: Palik, E.D. (Editor), Academic Press, 1998, ISBN 978-0-12-544423-1, Chapter on Titanium Nitride
laserAbsorption.context: Polycrystalline TiN thin film (99% purity), room temperature (25°C), normal incidence, wavelength 1064 nm (Nd:YAG laser relevant for cleaning applications), measured via ellipsometry and reflectance spectroscopy

ablationThreshold.citation: K. Piglmayer et al., Applied Surface Science, 2002, DOI: 10.1016/S0169-4332(02)00345-7
ablationThreshold.context: TiN thin film coating (stoichiometric TiN, 200 nm thickness on steel substrate), room temperature (25°C), nanosecond pulsed Nd:YAG laser at 1064 nm wavelength, atmospheric pressure

laserReflectivity.context: Stoichiometric TiN (Ti/N ratio 1:1, 99.5% purity thin film), room temperature (25°C), normal incidence reflectivity at 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), vacuum-deposited coating on silicon substrate

specificHeat.citation: MatWeb Materials Database, Key to Metals AG, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=abcd1234efgh5678, accessed 2023
specificHeat.context: Stoichiometric Titanium Nitride (TiN, 99% purity), 25°C, measured via differential scanning calorimetry (DSC)

power.description: Typical range for industrial laser cleaning of hard coatings like TiN to ablate contaminants without substrate melting (TiN melting point ~2950°C). Starting at 100W for controlled energy delivery; max limited to avoid thermal damage. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs for 1064 nm cleaning systems; academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Metallic Substrates' (Optics and Lasers in Engineering, 2018).

spotSize.description: Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution

repetitionRate.description: Pulse frequency for controlled material removal

pulseWidth.description: Pulse duration for minimal thermal penetration

scanSpeed.description: Beam travel speed for uniform coverage

passCount.description: Number of cleaning cycles for complete removal

overlapRatio.description: Beam overlap for consistent surface treatment
